FitCult

School Project | May 2023

Web application built by a team of 5 developers following weekly Agile sprints. Role: full-stack developer & scrum facilitator.

FitCult lets users create an account, store body-metrics (weight, height, lean mass), set fitness goals (weight loss, lean, bulk, etc.) and upload progress photos. All data is persisted in Firebase NoSQL. Front-end built with HTML + JavaScript.

HTML5 JavaScript CSS Firebase NoSQL Agile/Scrum

NAÏVE

School Project | May 2023

NAÏVE (Network Assessment, INVA/DE Viewer E-Tool) is a web application built to run on Kali Linux systems both locally and on the cloud (AWS/Azure).

Role: full-stack developer & database designer. Designed to help cybersecurity analysts aggregate and visualize data gathered during network assessments. NAÏVE integrates modern penetration testing tools, pipes data into backend database tables, and presents mission-critical insights through intuitive dashboards.

Multiple-Sequence Alignment Script

Undergrad Research | Sep 2022

Independent research under Dr. Daniel DeBlasio focused on improving multiple-sequence alignment (MSA) accuracy by integrating secondary-structure data.

Wrote a Python script that preprocesses FASTA files, augments alignments with DSSP-derived constraints, and outputs refined MSA ready for downstream analysis. Executed large-scale runs on a Linux server via command line, presented preliminary results in an undergraduate event to faculty and students.

Python Linux CLI Bioinformatics
